Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RNST-2-G4K (RSP-4, Synthetic AMPs, retro-NST-2 analog, XXD, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, designed, man-made sequences

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (64.29%) toLausporin-1L:23%, K=F: 15%.Chemical modification: A10, D-amino acid;  C-terminal amidation.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus NCTC 13277 MRSA (MIC 50 uM), B. subtilis ATCC 23857 (MIC 12.5 uM), Gram- S. typhi ATCC 14028 (MIC 100 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 50 uM), P.aeruginosa ATCC 10145 (MIC 200 uM), and fungi C. albicans ATCC 36082 (MIC 100 uM).Structure:  helical in 20 mM SDS.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: HC50 >100 uM (not hemo.lytic at 100 uM). Breast cancer cells MCF-7 (IC50 39.9 uM), cervical cancer Hela cells (IC50 56.9 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Abdullah SJ, Guan JS, Mu Y, Bhattacharjya S.2024
Literature Information.Title: Synthesis of Temporin-SHa Retro Analogs with Lysine Addition/Substitution and Antibiotic Conjugation to Enhance Antibacterial, Antifungal, and Anticancer Activities.
